metadata.title: CVE-2017-7043 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 10.3.3 isaffected. Safari before 10.1.2 is affected. iCloud before 6.2.2 on Windowsis affected. iTunes before 12.6.2 on Windows is affected. tvOS before10.2.2 is affected. The issue involves the "WebKit" component. It allowsremote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service(memory corruption and application crash) via a crafted web site.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7043` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.16.6-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.16.6-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.16.6-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.16.6-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.16.6-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.16.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.16.6-1').
webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
